did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Diary, 1918. This collection consists of a 20 page manuscript diary, dated September through October 1918, written by John C. Delbridge, of Bisbee, Arizona, while in France during World War I.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John C. Delbridge was living in Bisbee, Arizona in 1918 when he became a member of the United States Army during World War I. He kept a diary from September through October of 1918 recounting his experiences in France and at the Belgian Front.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Diary, 1918. This collection consists of a 20 page manuscript diary, dated September to October 1918, written by John C. Delbridge, of Bisbee, Arizona, while in France during World War I.

controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918
World War, 1914-1918 -- Personal narratives, American
World War, 1914-1918 -- Campaigns -- Western Front -- Personal narratives

scopecontent.p: This diary contains an account of Delbridge's experiences while serving in World War I. The diary details everyday life under combat and describes the effects of shelling, mustard gas, and trench warfare; forays Delbridge made into French towns; and the weather in France.
